TopicTitle: Seeing the rest of the navball?

Articles.Content:
My greatest gripe about the navball is how little of it is seen at the time. Say, while docking I need to face certain angle and if the prograde/retrograde markers vanish behind the edges, I have no clue which direction they are. Even normally, I can guess the general distance they are if I see any other marker, but not the direction.

Is there any method (mod?) that would give a better view of the markers? Say, something like the arrows like the blue arrow pointing the "maneuver" marker for the rest of the markers (or at least the prograde/retrograde ones)? Or some other way to display that information? (KER gives "horizontal" and "vertical" speeds, and that's better than nothing but still not quite enough.)

Edited June 8, 2015 by Sharpy

Not precisely what you're looking for, but try NavHUD: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81543-1-0-NavHud-a-NavBall-inspired-Heads-Up-Display-1-2-1

It's a really excellent mod, but I found it was breaking my sense of immersion.
Enhanced Navball has ghosting of the prograde/retrograde markers, among many other useful features (I love the resize and reposition functions). Highly recommended.
Thanks. That ghosting feature is exactly what I was looking for.
DOH! Good catch RIC. I even have E.H. but I abuse Mechjeb so badly I barely use the Navball outside of atmo (Except for docking.)
